page.title: 05TALK OF TOTTON
page.content: A recent survey of the residents of West Totton conducted by students revealed some interesting points. As part of their environmental studies they collated information from a questionnaire distributed to over 500 homes. The results pinpointed deficiencies in the development plan which will affect the population over the next 8 years. As this will rise to over 10,000 the survey showed a lack of basic amenities such as telephone boxes, letter boxes, and roads on the new estates have been made too narrow to take a standard service bus. With many of the new residents being young families there will be a need for a community centre, shops, a post office, a church, a doctors' surgery and a dentist. These have not been catered for.
